usefulItems: nut milk bag or muslin cloth, frying pan, egg rings, paper towel, bowl, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, turner/fish slice, stove top
title: Hash browns

ingredients.content: 1000 g potatoes, peeled and cut into halves
1 brown onion, cut into halves (approx.150 g)
1 tsp sea salt, plus extra to taste
1 pinch ground black pepper, plus extra to taste
grapeseed oil, for frying and greasing

preparations.content: Place potatoes into mixing bowl and chop <b>3-5 sec/speed 5<b>, until an evenly chopped chunky consistency is achieved. Transfer chopped potato into a nut milk bag, muslin cloth or simmering basket and squeeze potato firmly to remove any excess liquid. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
Place onion and garlic (optional) into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add plain flour, eggs, salt, pepper and reserved chopped potato and combine <b>20 sec//speed 4<b>.
Heat a little oil in a frying pan over a medium-high heat. Grease 4 egg rings with grapeseed oil and place into frying pan. Pour potato mixture into egg rings, filling each egg ring ¾ of the way.

Fry on both sides until golden brown and cooked through (approx. 3½ minutes on each side). Transfer into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, lined with paper towel to blot excess oil. Repeat with remaining batter, re-greasing egg rings with oil between each batch. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Serve your hash browns as part of a 'big breakfast' or with sour cream on the side, garnished with finely sliced spring onion/shallots.
